intro: Dipladenia tetradenia, commonly known as the four-leafed trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange to red tubular flowers. The plant produces showy, pendulous blooms that attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a glossy surface. Dipladenia tetradenia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
